Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a false article that was copied word-for-word from a satire website.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the anonymous op-ed was authored by an unnamed top official in the Trump administration.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that the NY Times admitted to being trolled when it was actually a false article from a satire website.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the op-ed was written by Art Tubolls, a fictitious character on a false news blog, without any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the op-ed and jumps to the conclusion that it was fake without proper evidence.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by relying on false information and not verifying the credibility of the sources it cites.
